text: Oh, don't pay attention to me, ------ [to continue] your conversation, please
explaniation: Phrasal verb 'to carry on' means 'to go on or continue with something'

text: It has been announced that ---- Pope is going to visit Warsaw
explaniation: It's correct to see The Pope

text: My neighbors ------ a terrible noise every evening.
Use a prefix to make a word negative: competent
Choose two forms of the verb 'to tear' according to the order: Past Simple - Past Participle
Benjamin _____ [to watch] a movie before Alison _____ [to come] in.
explaniation: Past Perfect Continuous emphasizes the duration of action  before another action or situation in the past

text: She always stands out for what she belives __
explaniation: It is correct to say 'believe in'

text: Her husband was accused __ cheating with 26-year-old model.
explaniation: Some adjectives are used with specific preposit'

text: I think we should move our [a ski] to garage.

text: British scientists have finally _____ important research.

explaniation: Phrasal verb 'to chew him out' means 'to criticize somebody angrily'

text: Choose two forms of the verb 'to wring' according to the order: Past Simple - Past Participle
These two vases look rather similar, _____ they are the same shape and color
explaniation: 'Inasmuch as' is used to add a comment with more details, explain something more clearly.
